alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 6:44PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Ulster and northwestern Dutchess Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 643 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Hurley, or near Kingston, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingston, Saugerties, Rhinebeck, Hurley, Saugerties South, Lake Katrine, Port Ewen, West Hurley, Mount Marion, Ellerslie, Rolling Meadows, Dutchess County Fairgrounds, Sweet Meadows, Flatbush, Sawkill, Rhinecliff, Hillside, Ulster Landing, Morgan Hill and Lincoln Park. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
